1.heading: Cooking.
1.title: "After Taking Waffles Out of Box, Place in Toaster..."
1.author: by Cliff Ledge.
notes: (Our First Year Off-Campus)
College panel in The State News (East Lansing, Mich.).

2.heading: Cooking.
2.title: "Agradecido"
2.author: [No author]
2.series: Condorito) p. 27 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: General Zapata gives the soldiers the afternoon off. Condorito goes fishing, but has to throw the fish back because the General has forbidden extra cooking. The fish shouts, "Viva Zapata!"

3.heading: Cooking.
3.title: "All My Life I Avoided Cooking like the Plague"
3.author: Wilson and DiPreta.
notes: Summary: Dexter has discovered he loves cooking.

4.heading: Cooking.
4.title: "Another Example of a College Cooking Disaster"
4.author: by Sarah Krebs.
notes: Summary: His hot pocket seems to have exploded in the microwave.

5.heading: Cooking.
5.title: "Anything Else You Want for Supper, Leroy, While I Have the Can Opener Out?"
5.author: Hoest & Reiner.

6.heading: Cooking.
6.title: "Anything I Cook Does Tend to Get Burnt, but Luckily I'm Not a Fussy Eater"
6.author: By Peter O'Donnell.
notes: From the Detroit Free Press, June 6, 1986).
Summary: Giles might have to cook for himself for a few days in the hinterland of Corsica.

7.heading: Cooking.
7.title: "Are You Guys Waiting for the Chef to Prepare Dinner For You?"
7.author: Bradley and Edgington.
notes: Summary: The boys were tempted to go ahead and cook for themselves.

8.heading: Cooking.
8.title: "The Barriers to Gourmet Cooking"
8.author: Hilary B
notes: Key words: Obscure ingredients, green pea tarragon vinegar, whipping meringue, deep frying, sprigs, herbs, quantities, simple recipes, thatching roofs, hidden catches.

9.heading: Cooking.
9.title: "Because I'm Already Fixing Something for Dinner"
9.author: Watterson.
notes: Summary: Calvin wants to go out for hamburgers, and Mom says no.

10.heading: Cooking.
10.title: "A Bit of Seasoning"
10.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood's making fried rice and Blondie approves, though she doesn't know that the seasonings include sausage, meatballs, shrimp, chicken and pastrami.

11.heading: Cooking.
11.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
11.author: [No author]

12.heading: Cooking.
12.title: "Brown Stuff with Orange Chunks and These Green Things In It That Kind of Ran Off the Plate"
12.author: H
notes: Summary: Harry and Helen try to recall what they ate last night so they can decide whose turn it is to cook tonight.

13.heading: Cooking.
13.title: "Business May Be Slow, but at Least We're Eating Well"
13.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Blondie and Tootsie are cooking rib roast, turkey, stuffed potatoes, creamed onions, corn pudding, cakes, and pies.

14.heading: Cooking.
14.title: "Can I Hatch That One For You?"
14.author: Bil Keane.
notes: Key words: Breaking eggs, cooking. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Hatching"

15.heading: Cooking.
15.title: "Can Love Survive Bending Over a Hot Stove on a Far Distant Planet?"
15.author: by Nicole Hollander.
notes: (Alien Lovers)
Summary: The alien husband wants a Thanksgiving dinner, on Venus. Maybe Martha Stewart will help.

16.heading: Cooking.
16.title: "Can't Pass Up a Cookbook, but Don't Remember the Last Time You Cooked?"
16.author: Nicole Hollander.
notes: Summary: Sylvia is starting a support group, where they'll read aloud from cookbooks and eat take-out food.

17.heading: Cooking.
17.title: "Can't You Answer the Front Door When I'm Cooking?"
17.author: Unger.
notes: Summary: He's in the bathtub.

18.heading: Cooking.
18.title: "The Case of the Bragging Boyfriend"
18.author: by Lawrence & Matera.
18.series: Can You Solve This Mystery?, Nov. 12, 1984
notes: Summary: Amy's parents "put on the best pig-outs in town," and Laurel's boyfriend is a suspected creep.

19.heading: Cooking.
19.title: "A Chip Off the Ol' Block"
19.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Andy has tried too hard to prove herself to her mother, and burned their Thanksgiving dinner.

20.heading: Cooking.
20.title: "Cocinero" ; p. 39 in Condorito Gigante, no. 418
20.author: [No author]
notes: SUMMARY: Condorito applies for a job at a restaurant, but he can't cook so they offer to buy him some cookbooks, but he can't read.

21.heading: Cooking.
21.title: "Cook Him a Meal!"
21.author: by Chris Browne.
notes: (Listen to Your Mother : Helga Tells It Like It Is)
Summary: Something she must not do until married.

23.heading: Cooking.
23.title: "Cooking is Extra"
23.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar and Lucky Eddie have found a very inexpensive restaurant, and have been served a live chicken.

24.heading: Cooking.
24.title: "Cowardice Revisited" 8 p. in Ghostly Tales, no. 84
24.author: [No author]
notes: Art signed: PAIII.

Summary: A young woman is cooking in a deserted Southern mansion. A motorcycle gang called Satan's Angels decides to tear up the house and begins threatening her. A civil war soldier comes back to life to rescue her. The mansion burns down. She invites the resurrected and redeemed former coward to her house to meet her folks.

25.heading: Cooking.
25.title: "Darling, After I Learn to Cook a Little Better, Will You Ask Your Boss to Dinner?"
25.author: by Clark.
notes: Summary: The scene is a one-room apartment where she's cooking on a hotplate and he's sitting on the bed.

26.heading: Cooking.
26.title: "Do It Yourself"
26.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: Louie tries to give advice in the kitchen, and ends up cooking (and burning) the meal himself.
Silent strip.

27.heading: Cooking.
27.title: "Don't Let My Wife Tell You It's Just Something She Threw Together"
27.author: by George Clark.
notes: Summary: Guests have arrived for dinner.

28.heading: Cooking.
28.title: "Don't Worry! I've Made Supper"
28.author: Alex Graham.
notes: Summary: She was stuck in traffic. The kitchen is a mess and full of smoke.

29.heading: Cooking.
29.title: "Ever Try to Build a Fire on the Side of a Mountain?"
29.author: by Johnny Hart.
notes: Summary: B.C. is surprised to find the guru on the mountaintop eating his food raw.

30.heading: Cooking.
30.title: "Everybody was so Fussy About the Way They Wanted Their Hamburgers Cooked"
30.author: Young & LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Alexander comes home complaining about his day.

31.heading: Cooking.
31.title: "Eyuk!"
31.author: by Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Beetle looks into the pot and says, "Eyuk!" Cookie decides to adopt the designation and writes it on the menu.

32.heading: Cooking.
32.title: "From Now on She's in Charge of Cooking"
32.author: by Bob Thaves.
notes: Summary: God and two angels looking down from a cloud see that Eve initiated the apple eating.

33.heading: Cooking.
33.title: "Give It To Me Straight, Doc"
33.author: Hoest & Reiner.
notes: Summary: Leroy asks his doctor about Loretta's cooking.

34.heading: Cooking.
34.title: "Go Ahead and Toss in the Bat Wings"
34.author: by Bill Rechin and Don Wilder.
notes: Summary: Two witches are cooking.

35.heading: Cooking.
35.title: "Great Cooking, Done by Somebody Else!"
35.author: by Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hamlet asks his dad for the secret to a happy life.

36.heading: Cooking.
36.title: "The Guy Who Lives Across the Street Wants to Know What You're Cooking"
36.author: Jim Unger.
notes: Summary: A man is at the door wearing a gas mask.

37.heading: Cooking.
37.title: "He Went Right Out and Got Me a Cook"
37.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: The first meal Mrs. Dithers made for Julius was a success.

38.heading: Cooking.
38.title: "Heaping or Level Tablespoons?"
38.author: by Brian Crane.
notes: Summary: Sylvia's recipe calls for two tablespoons of water.

39.heading: Cooking.
39.title: "Help! Help!"
39.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Goofy relaxes while Honey cooks, but then her mother calls and Honey has to rush over and see the new electric sweeper, and Goofy is left with a smoke-filled kitchen.

40.heading: Cooking.
40.title: "Herb and Jamaal are Cooking Dinner Tonight, Mama"
40.author: by Stephen Bentley.
notes: Summary: Herb cooks, and Jamaal stands by with the fire extinguisher.

41.heading: Cooking.
41.title: "Hercules Didn't Get That Way Cooking"
41.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The Major reads about a mountain retreat where he could relax, and Burke could get into shape, like Hercules. Burke likes cooking, fishing and swimming.

42.heading: Cooking.
42.title: "He's Home Right Now Cooking Dinner"
42.author: Young & Drake
42.appears_in: p. 103 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Blondie's friend has three degrees and runs a corporation, and Blondie's impressed: I guess we've seen the last of 'dumb blondes.' Her friend says no, she's married to one.

43.heading: Cooking.
43.title: "He's Up There Scraping Beans Off the Window"
43.author: Graham.
notes: Summary: Fred's master is trying to cook his own supper.

44.heading: Cooking.
44.title: "Hey! Cooking is Easy!"
44.author: by Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Sarge asks Cookie to teach Zero to cook. They start with stirring soup.

45.heading: Cooking.
45.title: "Hey! Look What Zog Do!"
45.author: Larson.
notes: Summary: Cavemen holding their meat over a fire with their hands look over and see Zog (who wears eyeglasses) using a stick.
Copyright 1980.

46.heading: Cooking.
46.title: "Hey, What's On Your Mind? Startin' a Lunch Counter?"
46.author: King.
notes: Summary: Corky asks Pudge to show him the cuts of beef, how to buy vegetables, and how to figure portions.

47.heading: Cooking.
47.title: "His Cooking is Definitely Related to Illness"
47.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Cosmo tries to deduct the cost of groceries on his income tax return.

48.heading: Cooking.
48.title: "How About Enough for Four, and Invite Some Girls?"
48.author: by Jerry Dumas and Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Sam and Silo try to decide how much to cook.

49.heading: Cooking.
49.title: "How Would I Know You Wanted It Cooked?"
49.author: Ramzah.
notes: Summary: A man has bought a fish sandwich.

50.heading: Cooking.
50.title: "I Can Get a Court Order to Stop You from Teaching Her to Cook"
50.author: Unger.

51.heading: Cooking.
51.title: "I Can't Stand My Own Cookin'!"
51.author: Fred Lasswell.
51.series: Barney Google and Snuffy Smith, Jan. 17, 1991
notes: Summary: The reason Snuffy's in the hoosegow while Loweezy's away from home.

52.heading: Cooking.
52.title: "I Don't Know Why You Bother with a Cooked Breafast, Flo"
52.author: Smythe.

53.heading: Cooking.
53.title: "I Don't Think You Should Have to Do Something Unless You're Enthusiastic About It"
53.author: by Bill Watterson.
notes: Summary: Mom's cooking, and Calvin tries to decline the opportunity to set the table.

54.heading: Cooking.
54.title: "I Feel Honored That You Come Here for Lunch"
54.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood is at the lunch counter saying what a great cook Blondie the caterer is.

55.heading: Cooking.
55.title: "I Guess My Cooking is OK After All!"
55.author: Scancarelli.
notes: Summary: Teeka is feeling better. She comes to the table hungry, and wants seconds.

56.heading: Cooking.
56.title: "I Have Never Smelled Pesto Like This!"
56.author: Wilson and DiPreta.
notes: Summary: Rex impresses William with his cooking ability.

57.heading: Cooking.
57.title: "I Haven't Cooked a Really Nice Meal for This Family in So Long"
57.author: Johnson.
notes: Summary: Janis is depressed about cooking.

58.heading: Cooking.
58.title: "I Like Cooking and they Treated Me like a Freak!"
58.author: by Paul Nichols ; LeDoux and Wilson.
notes: Summary: Harlin says most boys where he lives want to be hunters and woodsmen.

59.heading: Cooking.
59.title: "I Never Said You Were a Bad Cook, Rex"
59.author: Wilson and DiPreta.
notes: Summary: June points out that Rex always cooks the same things.

60.heading: Cooking.
60.title: "I Say We Stand Up To Her and Demand a Bowl of Cereal!"
60.author: Glenn.
notes: Summary: The twins are worried about all the smoke in the kitchen.

61.heading: Cooking.
61.title: "I Should Win An Oscar For This Performance"
61.author: Billingsley.
notes: Summary: Curtis eats Michelle's fried chicken and sweet potatoes, though he doesn't like them.

62.heading: Cooking.
62.title: "I Suppose I Should Be Flattered"
62.author: by Brian Basset.
notes: Summary: Theodore knows he likes Adam's cooking because he usually gets the lunch Adam makes when they trade at school.

63.heading: Cooking.
63.title: "I Told Him I Could Cook!"
63.author: Saunders and Giella.
notes: Summary: She threw her knockout punch.

64.heading: Cooking.
64.title: "I Try Not To Clutter My Mind With Unnecessary Details"
64.author: by Greg Howard and Craig MacIntosh.
notes: Key words: Baseball statistics, batting averages, memory, cooking ("Okay, now we're cookin'.")

65.heading: Cooking.
65.title: "I Want to Keep Them Coming Back!"
65.author: by Robb Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Joe's mother complains that Marcy and Joe don't cook for themselves, but she won't give them her secret recipe.

66.heading: Cooking.
66.title: "I Warms! Th' Okay Cafe Do th' Cookin'!"
66.author: Dick Moores.
notes: Summary: Rufus is sprucing up his house because Melba's coming to dinner. Joel didn't know Rufus could even cook.

67.heading: Cooking.
67.title: "I Was Reading the Cookbook Upside Down"
67.author: Hoest & Reiner.
notes: Summary: Loretta visits Leroy in the hospital.

68.heading: Cooking.
68.title: "I Wish There'd Been Domestic Science Courses on the Go When I Was Young"
68.author: Smythe.
notes: Summary: Flo worries that she's overcooking their meals, but Andy is oblivious.

69.heading: Cooking.
69.title: "I'd Just Like a Burger and Hold Everything, Thanks"
69.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Lucky Eddie tries to cook while holding everything.

70.heading: Cooking.
70.title: "If I Don't Have to Cook It, I Don't Care"
70.author: Johnson.
notes: Summary: Arlo is supposed to make dinner, but he brings home pizza.

71.heading: Cooking.
71.title: "I'll Cook Dinner When I Get Home"
71.author: by Jim Unger
71.appears_in: p. 21 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: A marriage counselor is on the phone with his wife, while his clients listen.

72.heading: Cooking.
72.title: "I'll Stir Up Some Vittles fer Me an' th' Boys"
72.author: Fred Lasswell.
72.series: Barney Google and Snuffy Smith, Mar. 9, 1988
notes: Summary: When Tater and Jughaid hear that Snuffy's going to cook, they decide to follow Loweezy to the church supper.

73.heading: Cooking.
73.title: "I'm Afraid Cookie Has Some Sort of Bad News"
73.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: The men are lined up with empty trays, and Cookie is standing on a box behind the counter with his clothes all blackened and smoking.

74.heading: Cooking.
74.title: "I'm Already in Advanced Defrosting"
74.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Lisa is enjoying cooking school.

75.heading: Cooking.
75.title: "I'm Even Learning to Cook from Scratch"
75.author: B
notes: Summary: Sylvia has been buying a can of peas and a can of carrots, and mixing them together.

76.heading: Cooking.
76.title: "In Your Stove, Where Else?"
76.author: Mell Lazarus.
notes: Summary: Tina has a tennis trophy, and Momma suggests a safe place to put it.

78.heading: Cooking.
78.title: "Ingredients"
78.author: Mercy Van Vlack.
notes: Summary: In a bowl, a cook is mixing joy, space, exercise, friends, and time for herself.

79.heading: Cooking.
79.title: "It Just Takes Time"
79.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Lucky Eddie tries to flip a pancake in the air.

80.heading: Cooking.
80.title: "It Was a Disaster"
80.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Tootsie used all her labor-saving devices, then cleaned them all, and then was too tired to eat the dinner.

81.heading: Cooking.
81.title: "It Would Give You a Nice Change of Pace from Whatever it is you do Around Here"
81.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Shoe doesn't see why Roz, the cook at the diner, doesn't cook for herself at home.

82.heading: Cooking.
82.title: "It's a Compound to Seal the Cracks in the Driveway"
82.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Roger compliments Andy on her cooking.

83.heading: Cooking.
83.title: "It's a New Recipe"
83.author: by Johnny Hart.
notes: Summary: When Lorraine's dish is touched it makes a sound like "keish!"

84.heading: Cooking.
84.title: "It's Flattering the Way You Savor Every Bite of My Cooking"
84.author: by Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Cookie comments when Sarge empties his whole tray in one gulp.

85.heading: Cooking.
85.title: "It's Right on the Package"
85.author: Ketcham.
notes: Summary: The Mitchells have dinner guests, and one seems to have asked for a recipe.

86.heading: Cooking.
86.title: "It's the Eating that's Hard"
86.author: Hoest & Reiner.
notes: Summary: Cooking looks easy with Loretta.

87.heading: Cooking.
87.title: "It's Time You Learned to Take Care of Yourself, Dexter"
87.author: Wilson & DiPreta.
notes: Summary: Berna tells Dexter he has to learn to cook.

88.heading: Cooking.
88.title: "It's Too Hot To Cook"
88.author: Sternecky.
notes: Summary: Albert wants Pogo to cook for him.

89.heading: Cooking.
89.title: "Je Ne Sais Quoi"
89.author: Hoest & Reiner.
notes: Summary: Loretta is learning about French food.

90.heading: Cooking.
90.title: "Just Out of Curiosity, Which One Is This?"
90.author: B
notes: Summary: Dan wants to marry Sylvia, though she can only cook two things: meatloaf and apple dumplings.

91.heading: Cooking.
91.title: "Just What Do You Make Anymore?"
91.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: Brutus wonders what Gladys does now that they have machines to make coffee, popcorn, pasta, and bread.

92.heading: Cooking.
92.title: "Last Year Alone, She Wore Out Three Smoke Alarms"
92.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Elmo complains about his mother's cooking.

93.heading: Cooking.
93.title: "The Lighter Side of..."
93.author: [No author]
93.series: Berg's-Eye View Dept.) p. 84-88 in Mad Super Special, no. 83
notes: Gag titles: Breaking Habits ; School Spirit ; Economics ; Divorce ; Crises ; Cooking ; Improvement ; Cleanliness ; Trust ; Girl Watching ; Higher Education ; Egos ; Doctors.

94.heading: Cooking.
94.title: "Like Mother Used to Make"
94.author: Yates-Casson.
notes: Summary: The food has to be thrown out.

95.heading: Cooking.
95.title: "Listen Up, Chef Boy-Ar-Dum, Nobody Cooks In This House"
95.author: by Darby Conley.
notes: Summary: Bucky orders tuna, sardines, and warm cream, and if he's lucky he'll get anchovies on his pizza.

96.heading: Cooking.
96.title: The Mad Book of Sex, Violence and Home Cooking
96.author: written by Dick DeBartolo ; illustrated by Harry North ; edited by Nick Meglin.

97.heading: Cooking.
97.title: "Making Pasta Isn't Cooking. It's Boiling Water"
97.author: by Ramona Fradon and Mary Schmich.
notes: Summary: Brenda cooks for Hank, and they make a toast to P. Post Pressman.

98.heading: Cooking.
98.title: "The Martyr"
98.author: by Gus Edson.
notes: Summary: He eats Millie's dinner, but it's like eating an old chain and he follows up with bicarb.

99.heading: Cooking.
99.title: "Maw! Cook Up some Chicken an' French Fry Some Hay!"
99.author: Fred Lasswell.
notes: Summary: Barney Google and Sparkplug have come to visit, and Snuffy's not for it until he hears Sparky's won money in the T-Bone Stakes.

100.heading: Cooking.
100.title: "Menu Venue"
100.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Plushie comes home tired, and the boarders have a scare thinking Emmy might be cooking dinner.

101.heading: Cooking.
101.title: "Mr. B., Can You Actually Cook Anything Beside Sandwiches?"
101.author: Young and LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Elmo keeps asking about Dagwood's cooking until it's clear that sandwiches and barbecuing are the extent of it.

102.heading: Cooking.
102.title: "Mom Says You Ate Frozen Waffles and Canned Soup Three Meals a Day"
102.author: Watterson.
notes: Summary: Calvin is surprised when his dad says he knows how to cook, since he lived alone for two years.

103.heading: Cooking.
103.title: "My First Act Will Be To Make You Do The Cooking"
103.author: Watterson.
notes: Summary: Dad's down in the polls, might be voted out and replaced by Mom as "Dad."

104.heading: Cooking.
104.title: "My Little Adam Cooking the Meals Around Here!"
104.author: by Brian Basset.
notes: Summary: Adam's mother can't believe he does the cooking, until she tastes the food.

105.heading: Cooking.
105.title: "My Wife Can't Cook, Either!"
105.author: Scrawls.
notes: Summary: His wife's out of town, so he eats at Pop's because it reminds him of home.

106.heading: Cooking.
106.title: "NewsWok"
106.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Neighbor Chan shows Fred his weekly magazine on Chinese cooking.

107.heading: Cooking.
107.title: "Nobody Cooks a Turkey Like You Do, Loretta"
107.author: Hoest & Reiner.
notes: Summary: Leroy has something to be thankful for on Thanksgiving Day.

108.heading: Cooking.
108.title: "Not a Great Cook, but a Fun One"
108.author: Young & Gersher.
notes: Summary: The fried eggs, the pancakes, and the toast all fly through the air as Dagwood makes breakfast.

109.heading: Cooking.
109.title: "Not that French Vittles Aren't Nice for a Change, but I Mostly Stick with Home Cookin'!"
109.author: Frank Bolle.

110.heading: Cooking.
110.title: "Now She Is Cooking Steak and Onions"
110.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Grandma's miffed; she hid Gramps's choppers.
Key word: Dentures.

111.heading: Cooking.
111.title: "OK, Now, What's the Bad News?"
111.author: Joe Martin.
notes: Summary: A man is getting comfortable in a big pot while cannibals heat it up.

112.heading: Cooking.
112.title: "Oh, Boy! Hot Dogs!"
112.author: Johson.
notes: Summary: Janis considers herself a failure as a mother, wife and woman because of what she's cooking, but Gene and Arlo don't see it that way.

113.heading: Cooking.
113.title: "Oh No! Not the Chef's Surprise Again!"
113.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar sees a cloud of smoke coming from the kitchen.

114.heading: Cooking.
114.title: "Once a Month, He'll Announce It's His 'Turn' to Fix Dinner!"
114.author: by Jimmy Johnson.

115.heading: Cooking.
115.title: "Once Upon a Time There Was a Little Old Italian Momma Who Couldn't Cook"
115.author: by Johnny Hart.
notes: Summary: The little ant asks for a bedtime story, and gets a fairy tale.

116.heading: Cooking.
116.title: "One Thing About Being a Lousy Cook: You Don't Have to Worry About Having an Off-Day"
116.author: Smythe.

117.heading: Cooking.
117.title: "Please Be Patient. Good Food Takes Time to Prepare"
117.author: Johnson.
notes: Summary: Gene wakes Janis in the recliner, and asks when's dinner.

118.heading: Cooking.
118.title: "Poke Holes in Plastic Cover"
118.author: by Bob Thaves.
notes: Summary: In the cookbook section of a bookstore or library, Ernest reveals his knowledge of cookery.

119.heading: Cooking.
119.title: "Prego or Ragu?"
119.author: by Greg Howard and Craig MacIntosh.
notes: Summary: Sally proposes beef Wellington for their dinner party, and Ted suggests something more familiar like spaghetti.

120.heading: Cooking.
120.title: "Put a Lid On It Till It's Done!"
120.author: J
notes: (When You'd Love to Live Forever)
Summary: Dad's cooking fish over a campfire, and the rest of the family is tortured with hunger.

121.heading: Cooking.
121.title: "Remember, If There's Nothing Else Available, You're a Wiz at Cookin' Fries"
121.author: Ramzah.
notes: Summary: He's looking in the employment classifieds.

122.heading: Cooking.
122.title: "Reprieve"
122.author: Gus Edson.
notes: Summary: Millie's dinner is burned, and they'll have to go to a restaurant.

123.heading: Cooking.
123.title: "Riders of the Range"
123.author: Neg Cochran.
notes: Summary: The men are cooking breakfast, and it's taking a long time because they're flipping things in the air from their frying pans.

124.heading: Cooking.
124.title: "Save His Hat"
124.author: Thaves.
notes: Cannibals are cooking an explorer in a pot, and they were told to bring a covered dish.

125.heading: Cooking.
125.title: "Second Helpings"
125.author: Susan Dewar.
notes: Summary: Walt's mother in law is mad at him and he doesn't know why.
Key words: Bangs, cooking, anger, reasons.

126.heading: Cooking.
126.title: "She Defrosted This Whole Dinner By Herself!"
126.author: by Clark.
notes: Summary: A mother is predicting that her daughter will be a good cook.

127.heading: Cooking.
127.title: "She Doesn't Want Me to Get Used to Well-Cooked Food"
127.author: Hoest & Reiner.
notes: Summary: Leroy explains why Loretta makes his lunch.

128.heading: Cooking.
128.title: "She Even Cooks Bad Stuff Good"
128.author: Ketcham.
notes: Summary: Dennis compliments his mother's cooking.

129.heading: Cooking.
129.title: "She Plans to Punish Him by Making Him Take Her Out to Dinner!"
129.author: Saunders, Ziegler, Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Jenny isn't cooking for Kevin tonight.

130.heading: Cooking.
130.title: "She'll Eat Anythin' I Dish Up, as Long as I Didn't Cook it"
130.author: Smythe.
notes: Summary: Flo is ill, and Andy takes her some fish and chips.

131.heading: Cooking.
131.title: "She's Burning My Favorite Meal Again"
131.author: by Hoest.
notes: Summary: Smoke is coming from the kitchen.

132.heading: Cooking.
132.title: "A Slick Scheme to Duck That Chinese Cooking"
132.author: by Harry O'Neill.
notes: Summary: The Boy Rangers are determined not to eat Ming Ling's cooking, and visit the Girl Rangers for handouts.

133.heading: Cooking.
133.title: "The Smaller the Group, the Worse the Food"
133.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy's mother explains the etiquette: for 100 people you get a caterer, for 25 people you get deli platters, but for a few people it has to be from scratch.

134.heading: Cooking.
134.title: "So We Won't Have to Eat Mom's Cooking"
134.author: Glenn.
notes: Summary: The twins think they should learn to cook.

135.heading: Cooking.
135.title: "So You're Using Cooking as a Kind of Escape?"
135.author: by Steve Alaniz and Francesco Marciuliano.
notes: Summary: Sally's making a new spaghetti sauce as a distraction, though she prefers to call it "aromatic therapy" rather than "escape."

136.heading: Cooking.
136.title: "Somehow This Doesn't Seem Right"
136.author: Cassatt & Brookins.
notes: Summary: Cosmo follows a televised recipe to the point where it seems to say to put the television set in the oven.

137.heading: Cooking.
137.title: "Sorry Teeka Doesn't Like My Cooking"
137.author: Scancarelli.
notes: Summary: Teeka's not well, probably it's something she ate.

138.heading: Cooking.
138.title: "Splat is Undercooked, Boing is Just Right"
138.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Cookie shows how to tell if the meatballs are ready by dropping one.

139.heading: Cooking.
139.title: "Stiff Spaghetti is Another Specialty"
139.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: The boarders complain about the Major's cooking, remembering his hard-boiled applesauce.

140.heading: Cooking.
140.title: "Sure! Justin Can Come Over to Dinner"
140.author: Young & LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Cookie wants to bring Justin to dinner, because his parents are out of town. Either that or she'll go cook for Justin at his house.

141.heading: Cooking.
141.title: "Thank Goodness for Eye of Newt Helper"
141.author: by Ralph Dunagin.
notes: Summary: Two witches are cooking in a cauldron.

142.heading: Cooking.
142.title: "Thanks For Not Saying Anything Bad About Her Cooking"
142.author: Mell Lazarus.
notes: Summary: Momma leaves after Tina's meal, saying she can't talk on an upset stomach.

143.heading: Cooking.
143.title: "That Depends on How Good a Cook You Are"
143.author: Hart.
notes: Summary: The advice columnist, Miss Know-it-All, is asked about drinks before dinner.

144.heading: Cooking.
144.title: "That Puts 'em in the Pan with the Fish"
144.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The boarders were worried and come looking for Amos, and find him cooking fish in his campsite. He offers them a helicopter ride.

145.heading: Cooking.
145.title: "That Was Delicious. I Love Miranda's Cooking!"
145.author: LeDoux and Wilson.
notes: Summary: Ramon and Trudi are away, and he has Abbey to himself.

146.heading: Cooking.
146.title: "There Probably Would Be a Lot Less of You"
146.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: It's not quite true that Hagar would be nothing without Helga.

147.heading: Cooking.
147.title: "There's Still Somethin' Missin'"
147.author: Ketcham.
notes: Summary: Dennis and Joey have the kitchen in a mess, and Dennis is sampling a batter they've made.

148.heading: Cooking.
148.title: "They're Free"
148.author: Young & Gersher.
notes: Summary: Herb compliment's Blondie's cooking, and Dagwood asks him what he like best about her dinners. Dagwood and Herb are playing pool.

149.heading: Cooking.
149.title: "They're Registered with the Police as Dangerous Weapons"
149.author: Yates-Casson.
notes: Summary: Mawsquaw's hands are registered, not for karate but for cooking.

150.heading: Cooking.
150.title: "This is the First Time We've Had Family Home, and I Didn't Have to Cook"
150.author: Lynn.
150.series: For Better or For Worse, July 11, 1997
notes: Summary: Elly's mother is in the hospital, but looking at the bright side.

151.heading: Cooking.
151.title: "Touch My Food and Die!"
151.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Jon tries to keep Garfield from taking his meal, but Garfield says Jon doesn't cook quite that badly.

152.heading: Cooking.
152.title: "Walt, You Need a Dog"
152.author: Susan Dewar.
notes: Summary: Mom's feelings are hurt, but he doesn't want to encourage her to make quiche again.
Key word: Cooking.

153.heading: Cooking.
153.title: "Watch Out! You're Knocking Everything Over With Your Tail!"
153.author: by Darby Conley.
notes: Summary: Rob is trying to cook, and Bucky is on the counter talking about how he uses his tail to hold ratsicles.

154.heading: Cooking.
154.title: "We Could Almost Eat This"
154.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Dad's cooking is improving.

155.heading: Cooking.
155.title: "We Seem to Eat Out a Lot When It's Your Night to Cook"
155.author: Johnson.
notes: Summary: Janis objects to Arlo's attitude toward cooking.

156.heading: Cooking.
156.title: "What Are You Making for Dinner Tonight?"
156.author: by Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar and Helga are on the beach, and Hagar makes a speech about how nice it is to have nothing to do but relax.

157.heading: Cooking.
157.title: "What Cooks?"
157.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Flossie fakes a faint, which is the signal for all the girls to gather in the powder room.

158.heading: Cooking.
158.title: "What Does Babysittin' Daddy Have to Do with Cookin'?"
158.author: Glenn.
notes: Summary: The twins offer to help cook, and their energy scares mom.

159.heading: Cooking.
159.title: "What Does 'Culinary Arts' Mean?"
159.author: Hart.
notes: Summary: He's selling correspondence courses.

160.heading: Cooking.
160.title: "What We Don't Got is a Lobster Who's Willing to Die in the Pot"
160.author: by Jerry Dumas and Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Sam and Silo are trying to cook, and the lobster has grabbed the cookbook.

161.heading: Cooking.
161.title: "What's So Special About Her Cooking?"
161.author: Smythe.
notes: Summary: Flo hasn't come back to Andy, and he misses the free cooking.

162.heading: Cooking.
162.title: "What's That You're Cooking?"
162.author: Joe Martin.
notes: Summary: Willy is trying to write a farewell letter to Ethel, and is distracted by an aroma.

163.heading: Cooking.
163.title: "What's the Problem?"
163.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: A letter to the advice column is about a woman who cooks well, yet her husband makes himself big snacks. Blondie reads the letter to Dagwood.

164.heading: Cooking.
164.title: "When Things Return to Normal We'll Have to Hire a Cook"
164.author: by Clark.

165.heading: Cooking.
165.title: "Where'd You Learn to Make an Omelet Like That?"
165.author: Harold LeDoux.
notes: Summary: The police are following a limo, while Becky cooks for Sam.

166.heading: Cooking.
166.title: "Who Cooks At Home When Your Mother's Away?"
166.author: DiPreta, Bradley and Edgington.
notes: Summary: Joanie says her grandfather does the cooking even when her mother is home.

167.heading: Cooking.
167.title: "Who Has Time For Food?"
167.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy and her mother are supposedly preparing Thanksgiving dinner. Cathy is stewing while being grilled, reaching the boiling point, simmering, and having her defenses chopped up.

168.heading: Cooking.
168.title: "Why Don't You Offer to Cook Her Some Vittles?"
168.author: Fred Lasswell.
notes: Summary: Loweezy is sick in bed.

169.heading: Cooking.
169.title: "Wienies and Beans"
169.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Blondie remarks how easy it seems to cook for her family after catering fancy dinners, and Dagwood asks what's for dinner.

170.heading: Cooking.
170.title: "A Wife-to-be Isn't Worth Her Salt Unless She Can Cook for Her Man"
170.author: by Brian Crane.

171.heading: Cooking.
171.title: "Would There Be Any Peeling Involved?"
171.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Beetle responds to an invitation to cook with someone, while standing in a room full of potatoes to peel.

172.heading: Cooking.
172.title: "Would You Mind Sharing It with the Rest of the City?"
172.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
notes: Summary: Blondie asks Dagwood about her cooking, and he compares it with her kissing.

173.heading: Cooking.
173.title: "Yes, it Smells Delicious From Away In Here Even"
173.author: J
notes: (Heroes are Made, Not Born)
Summary: Dad was on K.P. in the army a lot, so he's confident about making a tray to take up to Ma.

174.heading: Cooking.
174.title: "Yes, That's Why I Cook"
174.author: D&R.
notes: Summary: The husband appreciates supper, then goes to watch TV until bedtime.

175.heading: Cooking.
175.title: "You Could At Least L'arn Him How To Cook Afore Ye Go!"
175.author: Fred Lasswell.
175.series: Barney Google and Snuffy Smith, Jan. 26, 1989
notes: Summary: Loweezy says either the dog goes, or she goes.

176.heading: Cooking.
176.title: "You Fix a Mean Tuna Casserole"
176.author: Wilson & DiPreta.
notes: Summary: Dexter Holt has taken up cooking, and Officer Wilson appreciates it.

177.heading: Cooking.
177.title: "You Guys are Just Lousy Eaters"
177.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: To prove that complaints about his cooking are unjustified, Cookie has found a bunch of animals that enjoy his food.

178.heading: Cooking.
178.title: "You Have No Idea What Goes Into the Preparation of One of My Dinners"
178.author: Lincoln Peirce.
notes: Summary: Nate complains about his dad's cooking, and suspects it's done in a cauldron with a witch's hat.

179.heading: Cooking.
179.title: "You Know How To Put Out Fires, Don't You?"
179.author: Gordon Bess.
notes: Summary: Redeye tells Pokey to help his mother with breakfast.

180.heading: Cooking.
180.title: "You Lost the Bet, and I'm Not Cooking for 16 Hungry Bowlers"
180.author: [No author]

181.heading: Cooking.
181.title: "You'd Better Smile in the Next Three Seconds"
181.author: Amend.
notes: Summary: Andy thinks she should do more with her life than being a mother and cleaning and watching game shows, and Roger reminds her that she does the cooking.

182.author: Amend.
notes: Summary: Paige wants to call Domino's, and assumes her father has asked her a trick question.

183.title: "You'll Have to Cook Something For Me"
183.author: Hoest & Reiner.

notes: Summary: June comments on Rex's cooking.

185.author: King.
notes: Summary: Corky is taking Skeezix to see where he works and meet his boss.

notes: Begins: Hello, Peg, how was school today? Terrible.
Data from Gene Reed and Lou Mougin, via Grand Comic-Book Database.

188.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood still thinks the soup tastes like dishwater.

193.author: Bill Freyse.

205.heading: Cooking Lessons.
205.title: "A Wife-to-be Isn't Worth Her Salt Unless She Can Cook for Her Man"
205.author: by Brian Crane.

206.author: Chance Browne.

207.heading: Cooking Papa.
207.title: Kukkingu Papa = Cooking Papa
207.author: Ueyama Tochi.
notes: (Moningu KC)

Summary (from Ohio State University): Araiwa Kazumi is chief of a section of the sales department at Kanemaru Sangyo, which is based in Hakata, Kyushu district. He is married to a woman who is working at a local newpaper company. They seem to be an ordinary couple, except for one secret that Araiwa wants to hide
he loves to cook. As his wife is not good at housekeeping, he does almost everything in his house and he also makes people around him happy with his cooking skills.
Includes recipes.

260.heading: Cooks.
260.title: "The Iceman and the Cook : A Piece for the Box" p. 48 in Tijuana Bibles, Art and Wit in America's Forbidden Funnies, 1930s-1950s
260.author: Bob Adelman (New York : Simon & Schuster, 1997).
notes: A Tijuana bible reprint.

261.heading: Cooks.
261.title: "I'd Say You Picked a Bad Time to Fire Your Cook"
261.author: Unger.
notes: Summary: A doctor is addressing a patient with a saucepan stuck on his head.

262.heading: Cooks.
262.title: "Ingredients"
262.author: Mercy Van Vlack.
notes: Summary: In a bowl, a cook is mixing joy, space, exercise, friends, and time for herself.

263.heading: Cooks.
263.title: "It Would Give You a Nice Change of Pace from Whatever it is you do Around Here"
263.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Shoe doesn't see why Roz, the cook at the diner, doesn't cook for herself at home.

264.heading: Cooks.
264.title: "Just What Have You Been Doing Behind My Back?"
264.author: Dean Young.
notes: Summary: The owner of the diner gets compliments on the beef stew, the liver and onions, and the chicken a la king, and goes to the kitchen to confront his cook.

265.heading: Cooks.
265.title: "Kick the Cook"
265.author: by Gary Larson.
notes: Summary: A horse is doing a backyard barbecue, and the only words are on its apron.

266.heading: Cooks.
266.title: "Moistening the Steak"
266.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Key words: Cooks, attitudes, throwing. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Moistening"

267.heading: Cooks.
267.title: "My Hat is Bigger Than Yours"
267.author: by Dan Piraro.
notes: Summary: Tempers flare in a hot kitchen.

268.heading: Cooks.
268.title: "Not a Great Cook, but a Fun One"
268.author: Young & Gersher.
notes: Summary: The fried eggs, the pancakes, and the toast all fly through the air as Dagwood makes breakfast.

269.heading: Cooks.
269.title: "Now- It's Good- I Wish I Hadn't Let Her Go"
269.author: Geo
notes: Summary: The cook is making corned beef and cabbage, and Jiggs wants to know why he can't have some. He leaves for the old neighborhood while Maggie fires the cook.

270.heading: Cooks.
270.title: "One More Complaint out of My Family on the Meals and I'll Get a Job in a War Plant Myself, Where All of our Various Cooks Have Gone!"
270.author: by Galbraith.

271.heading: Cooks.
271.title: "The One Stirring the Gravy with her Hands is Bertha"
271.author: by Kevin McCormick.
notes: Summary: Arnold gives a tour of the school cafeteria kitchen.

272.heading: Cooks.
272.title: "One Thing About Being a Lousy Cook: You Don't Have to Worry About Having an Off-Day"
272.author: Smythe.

273.heading: Cooks.
273.title: "El Pelo"
273.author: [No author]
273.series: Condorito) p. 89 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: A customer complains about a hair in his soup, and it's a big one. Condorito is the cook.

274.heading: Cooks.
274.title: "She Only Makes Stuff I Like"
274.author: Ketcham.
notes: Summary: Dennis has figured out what makes Mrs. Wilson a good cook.

275.heading: Cooks.
275.title: "Spelling It Out"
275.author: Neg E
notes: Summary: The camp cook will only fry the fish if the fishermen clean them first.

276.heading: Cooks.
276.title: "Spice Cadet"
276.author: Thaves.
notes: Summary: He was an "apprentice chef at NASA."

277.heading: Cooks.
277.title: "Suddenly, in the Middle of the Flock, the Cook is Goosed"
277.author: Larson.
notes: Summary: The cook is among geese.

278.heading: Cooks.
278.title: "They Just Captured Our Cook and the Mess Wagon!"
278.author: Parker.
notes: Summary: The soldiers are completely surrounded, but there is some hope.

279.heading: Cooks.
279.title: "This is the Tepee of Sendem Gravequick"
279.author: Yates-Casson.
notes: Summary: Gravequick is the camp cook.

280.heading: Cooks.
280.title: "Too Many Cooks" 2 p. text in Millie the Model Comics, no. 24
280.author: [No author]

281.heading: Cooks.
281.title: "What's For Dinner?"
281.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake.
notes: Summary: Cookie meets Dagwood at the door saying he needs to say something to Blondie to "restore her faith as a cook."

282.heading: Cooks.
282.title: "When Things Return to Normal We'll Have to Hire a Cook"
282.author: by Clark.

283.heading: Cooks.
283.title: "Where Men are Men"
283.author: J
notes: Summary: One of the men has come over from the bunkhouse in a blizzard in his longjohns, to ask Cooky what to do for a bad cold.

284.heading: Cooks.
284.title: "Why Don't You Go On Back and Return in a Week or Two, David!"
284.author: by Paul Nichols ; Harold LeDoux.
notes: Summary: Mr. Hastings says David can go with Abbey, and meanwhile Mrs. Adams asks Laura, her cook, if there were any calls.

285.heading: Cooks.
285.title: "Why Don't You Throw It at the One Who Cooks It?"
285.author: Jim Unger.
notes: Summary: Dad has a bowl of food on his head.

286.heading: Cooks.
286.title: "The Winners"
286.author: J
notes: Summary: Four outfits were buying him drinks, so the new cook can't walk, but they've hired him and dragged him out to the ranch.

287.heading: Cooks.
287.title: "Your Stew is Horrible! I Wouldn't Feed It to Hogs!"
287.author: Dean Young.
notes: Summary: Dagwood complains to the cook at the lunch counter.

288.heading: Cooks.
288.title: "You're a Wunnerful Cook, Puddin'"
288.author: Harold Gray.
notes: Summary: Tink has the idea that Annie should move in, but does the Duchess know?

289.title: "Cook's Tour"
289.author: Sam Glanzman
289.appears_in: p. 72-81 in Streetwise : Autobiographical Stories (Raleigh, NC : TwoMorrows Publishing, 2000).

290.heading: Cook's Tours.
290.title: "Crooks' Tour of Palisades Park"
290.author: [No author]
notes: Data from Gene Reed.

291.heading: Cooky.
291.title: "Where Men are Men"
291.author: J
notes: Summary: One of the men has come over from the bunkhouse in a blizzard in his longjohns, to ask Cooky what to do for a bad cold.
